articles.headline: Minnesota Officer Who Shot Daunte Wright Meant to Fire Taser, Chief Says
articles.snippet: Hours after body camera video of the killing was released, protesters gathered outside the Brooklyn Center police station despite a new curfew for much of the Twin Cities region.
articles.abstract: Hours after body camera video of the killing was released, protesters gathered outside the Brooklyn Center police station despite a new curfew for much of the Twin Cities region.
articles.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN CENTER, Minn. — The officer who fatally shot a Black man during a traffic stop near Minneapolis mistakenly confused her gun for her Taser, police officials said on Monday, quickly releasing video as they tried to ease tensions in a state on edge over the Derek Chauvin trial.
articles.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Julie Bosman and Shawn Hubler

articles.headline: ‘Bond Girl’ Talk and Groping: Albany’s Toxic Culture for Women
articles.snippet: As allegations against Gov. Andrew Cuomo put a new spotlight on sexual misconduct in New York’s capital, numerous women there described an enduring predatory and misogynistic environment.
articles.abstract: As allegations against Gov. Andrew Cuomo put a new spotlight on sexual misconduct in New York’s capital, numerous women there described an enduring predatory and misogynistic environment.
articles.lead_paragraph: A legislative aide in New York’s state capital grabbed the thigh of a lobbyist so hard at a fund-raiser that he left finger-shaped bruises on her skin. A top official at a state agency projected a picture of a colleague in a bikini for all to see in a meeting she was attending.
articles.byline: By Sydney Ember, J. David Goodman and Luis Ferré-Sadurní

articles.headline: Surging Virus Has Michigan’s Democratic Governor at Loggerheads With Biden
articles.snippet: As Gov. Gretchen Whitmer pleads for more coronavirus vaccine, the Biden administration on Monday urged her to shut Michigan down, something she wants to avoid.
articles.abstract: As Gov. Gretchen Whitmer pleads for more coronavirus vaccine, the Biden administration on Monday urged her to shut Michigan down, something she wants to avoid.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Biden administration and Michigan’s Democratic governor are locked in an increasingly tense standoff over the state’s worst-in-the-nation coronavirus outbreak, with a top federal health official on Monday urging the governor to lock down her state.
articles.byline: By Noah Weiland and Mitch Smith

articles.headline: ‘Master,’ ‘Slave’ and the Fight Over Offensive Terms in Computing
articles.snippet: Nearly a year after the Internet Engineering Task Force took up a plan to replace words that could be considered racist, the debate is still raging.
articles.abstract: Nearly a year after the Internet Engineering Task Force took up a plan to replace words that could be considered racist, the debate is still raging.
articles.lead_paragraph: Anyone who joined a video call during the pandemic probably has a global volunteer organization called the Internet Engineering Task Force to thank for making the technology work.

articles.headline: The Only Ones Arrested After a Child’s Rape: The Women Who Helped Her
articles.snippet: The assault of a 13-year-old girl in Venezuela and the arrest of her mother and a teacher who helped her end the pregnancy have forced a national debate about legalizing abortion.
articles.abstract: The assault of a 13-year-old girl in Venezuela and the arrest of her mother and a teacher who helped her end the pregnancy have forced a national debate about legalizing abortion.
articles.lead_paragraph: MÉRIDA, Venezuela — She wore a ponytail and a red T-shirt, the words “Glitter Girl” sketched across the front.
articles.byline: By Julie Turkewitz, Isayen Herrera and Meridith Kohut

articles.headline: Johnson & Johnson Vaccinations Paused After Rare Clotting Cases Emerge
articles.snippet: Federal health officials called for a halt in the use of the company’s coronavirus vaccine while they study serious illnesses that developed in six American women.
articles.abstract: Federal health officials called for a halt in the use of the company’s coronavirus vaccine while they study serious illnesses that developed in six American women.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Injections of Johnson & Johnson’s coronavirus vaccine came to a sudden halt across the country on Tuesday after federal health agencies called for a pause in the vaccine’s use as they examine a rare blood-clotting disorder that emerged in six recipients.
articles.byline: By Noah Weiland, Sharon LaFraniere and Carl Zimmer

articles.headline: Hungry for Investors, Some Companies Woo the Little Guy
articles.snippet: Small investors are becoming a force in the stock market, and company executives are beginning to take notice.
articles.abstract: Small investors are becoming a force in the stock market, and company executives are beginning to take notice.
articles.lead_paragraph: After CarParts.com reported its quarterly results last month, executives at the company, which sells replacement auto parts, did what many of their ilk do: They held a conference call with Wall Street analysts, fielding questions about inventory levels, profit margins and corporate strategy.
